page.title: 11CINEMA IN THE 1930'S
page.content: Nelly Simpson now lives in Valley House Old People's Home,Leicester. In the 1930's she went to the pictures about once a week.She went to the Belgrave cinema which was on the Belgrave Road where an Indian cinema is today.She could not remember the first film she saw but it would probably be in black and white and silent.In those days a visit to the cinema only cost a few pence.An organ came up from the floor playing music at the beginning of each show.Cinemas, then, were usually packed full of people.During World War 2 the cinema was very popular because of news reels which let people know what was going on during the war.Nelly loved to go the cinema with her friends and family because the atmosphere was like that of a neighbourhood centre today. {
